C:/Users/New/Documents/Games_Technology/Year4_Semester1/ICT397/~My Work/Assignment2/ICT397Carre/CarreGameEngine/Dependencies/BulletPhysicsEngine/include/BulletDynamics/Featherstone/btMultiBody.h

00001 /*
00002  * PURPOSE:
00003  *   Class representing an articulated rigid body. Stores the body's
00004  *   current state, allows forces and torques to be set, handles
00005  *   timestepping and implements Featherstone's algorithm.
00006  *   
00007  * COPYRIGHT:
00008  *   Copyright (C) Stephen Thompson, <stephen@solarflare.org.uk>, 2011-2013
00009  *   Portions written By Erwin Coumans: connection to LCP solver, various multibody constraints, replacing Eigen math library by Bullet LinearMath and a dedicated 6x6 matrix inverse (solveImatrix)
00010  *   Portions written By Jakub Stepien: support for multi-DOF constraints, introduction of spatial algebra and several other improvements
00011 
00012  This software is provided 'as-is', without any express or implied warranty.
00013  In no event will the authors be held liable for any damages arising from the use of this software.
00014  Permission is granted to anyone to use this software for any purpose,
00015  including commercial applications, and to alter it and redistribute it freely,
00016  subject to the following restrictions:
00017  
00018  1. The origin of this software must not be misrepresented; you must not claim that you wrote the original software. If you use this software in a product, an acknowledgment in the product documentation would be appreciated but is not required.
00019  2. Altered source versions must be plainly marked as such, and must not be misrepresented as being the original software.
00020  3. This notice may not be removed or altered from any source distribution.
00021  
00022  */

00209         btTransform getBaseWorldTransform() const
00210         {
00211                 btTransform tr;
00212                 tr.setOrigin(getBasePos());
00213                 tr.setRotation(getWorldToBaseRot().inverse());
00214                 return tr;
00215         }

00337     //
00338     // dynamics routines.
00339     //
00340 
00341     // timestep the velocities (given the external forces/torques set using addBaseForce etc).
00342     // also sets up caches for calcAccelerationDeltas.
00343     //
00344     // Note: the caller must provide three vectors which are used as
00345     // temporary scratch space. The idea here is to reduce dynamic
00346     // memory allocation: the same scratch vectors can be re-used
00347     // again and again for different Multibodies, instead of each
00348     // btMultiBody allocating (and then deallocating) their own
00349     // individual scratch buffers. This gives a considerable speed
00350     // improvement, at least on Windows (where dynamic memory
00351     // allocation appears to be fairly slow).
00352     //
00353    
00354  
00355         void computeAccelerationsArticulatedBodyAlgorithmMultiDof(btScalar dt,
00356                         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> &scratch_r,
00357                         btAlignedObjectArray<btVector3> &scratch_v,
00358                         btAlignedObjectArray<btMatrix3x3> &scratch_m,
00359                         bool isConstraintPass=false
00360                 );
00361 
00363         void stepVelocitiesMultiDof(btScalar dt,
00364                         btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> &scratch_r,
00365                         btAlignedObjectArray<btVector3> &scratch_v,
00366                         btAlignedObjectArray<btMatrix3x3> &scratch_m,
00367                         bool isConstraintPass=false)
00368         {
00369                 computeAccelerationsArticulatedBodyAlgorithmMultiDof(dt,scratch_r,scratch_v,scratch_m,isConstraintPass);
00370         }
00371 
00372     // calcAccelerationDeltasMultiDof
00373     // input: force vector (in same format as jacobian, i.e.:
00374     //                      3 torque values, 3 force values, num_links joint torque values)
00375     // output: 3 omegadot values, 3 vdot values, num_links q_double_dot values
00376     // (existing contents of output array are replaced)
00377     // calcAccelerationDeltasMultiDof must have been called first.
00378         void calcAccelerationDeltasMultiDof(const btScalar *force, btScalar *output,
00379                                 btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> &scratch_r,
00380                                 btAlignedObjectArray<btVector3> &scratch_v) const;
00381         
00382   
00383         void applyDeltaVeeMultiDof2(const btScalar * delta_vee, btScalar multiplier)
00384         {
00385                 for (int dof = 0; dof < 6 + getNumDofs(); ++dof)
00386                 {
00387                         m_deltaV[dof] += delta_vee[dof] * multiplier;
00388                 }
00389         }
00390         void processDeltaVeeMultiDof2()
00391         {
00392                 applyDeltaVeeMultiDof(&m_deltaV[0],1);
00393 
00394                 for (int dof = 0; dof < 6 + getNumDofs(); ++dof)
00395                 {
00396                         m_deltaV[dof] = 0.f;
00397                 }
00398         }
00399 
00400         void applyDeltaVeeMultiDof(const btScalar * delta_vee, btScalar multiplier) 
00401         {
00402                 //for (int dof = 0; dof < 6 + getNumDofs(); ++dof)
00403                 //      printf("%.4f ", delta_vee[dof]*multiplier);
00404                 //printf("\n");
00405 
00406                 //btScalar sum = 0;
00407                 //for (int dof = 0; dof < 6 + getNumDofs(); ++dof)
00408                 //{
00409                 //      sum += delta_vee[dof]*multiplier*delta_vee[dof]*multiplier;
00410                 //}
00411                 //btScalar l = btSqrt(sum);
00412 
00413                 //if (l>m_maxAppliedImpulse)
00414                 //{
00415                 //      multiplier *= m_maxAppliedImpulse/l;
00416                 //}
00417 
00418                 for (int dof = 0; dof < 6 + getNumDofs(); ++dof)
00419                 {
00420                         m_realBuf[dof] += delta_vee[dof] * multiplier;
00421                         btClamp(m_realBuf[dof],-m_maxCoordinateVelocity,m_maxCoordinateVelocity);
00422                 }
00423     }

00434 
00435     // This routine fills out a contact constraint jacobian for this body.
00436     // the 'normal' supplied must be -n for body1 or +n for body2 of the contact.
00437     // 'normal' & 'contact_point' are both given in world coordinates.
00438         
00439         void fillContactJacobianMultiDof(int link,
00440                              const btVector3 &contact_point,
00441                              const btVector3 &normal,
00442                              btScalar *jac,
00443                              btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> &scratch_r,
00444                              btAlignedObjectArray<btVector3> &scratch_v,
00445                                                          btAlignedObjectArray<btMatrix3x3> &scratch_m) const { fillConstraintJacobianMultiDof(link, contact_point, btVector3(0, 0, 0), normal, jac, scratch_r, scratch_v, scratch_m); }
00446 
00447         //a more general version of fillContactJacobianMultiDof which does not assume..
00448         //.. that the constraint in question is contact or, to be more precise, constrains linear velocity only
00449         void fillConstraintJacobianMultiDof(int link,
00450                              const btVector3 &contact_point,
00451                                                          const btVector3 &normal_ang,
00452                              const btVector3 &normal_lin,
00453                              btScalar *jac,
00454                              btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> &scratch_r,
00455                              btAlignedObjectArray<btVector3> &scratch_v,
00456                              btAlignedObjectArray<btMatrix3x3> &scratch_m) const;

00630         
00631         void updateLinksDofOffsets()
00632         {
00633                 int dofOffset = 0, cfgOffset = 0;
00634                 for(int bidx = 0; bidx < m_links.size(); ++bidx)
00635                 {
00636                         m_links[bidx].m_dofOffset = dofOffset; m_links[bidx].m_cfgOffset = cfgOffset;
00637                         dofOffset += m_links[bidx].m_dofCount; cfgOffset += m_links[bidx].m_posVarCount;
00638                 }
00639         }
00640 
00641         void mulMatrix(btScalar *pA, btScalar *pB, int rowsA, int colsA, int rowsB, int colsB, btScalar *pC) const;
00642         
00643         
00644 private:
00645 
00646         btMultiBodyLinkCollider* m_baseCollider;//can be NULL
00647         const char*                             m_baseName;//memory needs to be manager by user!
00648 
00649     btVector3 m_basePos;       // position of COM of base (world frame)
00650     btQuaternion m_baseQuat;   // rotates world points into base frame
00651 
00652     btScalar m_baseMass;         // mass of the base
00653     btVector3 m_baseInertia;   // inertia of the base (in local frame; diagonal)
00654 
00655     btVector3 m_baseForce;     // external force applied to base. World frame.
00656     btVector3 m_baseTorque;    // external torque applied to base. World frame.
00657    
00658     btVector3 m_baseConstraintForce;     // external force applied to base. World frame.
00659     btVector3 m_baseConstraintTorque;    // external torque applied to base. World frame.
00660  
00661     btAlignedObjectArray<btMultibodyLink> m_links;    // array of m_links, excluding the base. index from 0 to num_links-1.
00662 
00663     
00664     //
00665     // realBuf:
00666     //  offset         size            array
00667     //   0              6 + num_links   v (base_omega; base_vel; joint_vels)                                    MULTIDOF [sysdof x sysdof for D matrices (TOO MUCH!) + pos_delta which is sys-cfg sized]
00668     //   6+num_links    num_links       D
00669     //
00670     // vectorBuf:
00671     //  offset         size         array
00672     //   0              num_links    h_top
00673     //   num_links      num_links    h_bottom
00674     //
00675     // matrixBuf:
00676     //  offset         size         array
00677     //   0              num_links+1  rot_from_parent
00678     //
00679    btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> m_deltaV; 
00680     btAlignedObjectArray<btScalar> m_realBuf;
00681     btAlignedObjectArray<btVector3> m_vectorBuf;
00682     btAlignedObjectArray<btMatrix3x3> m_matrixBuf;
00683
